title: BlackRock
added: In August 2021, BlackRock set up its first mutual fund in China after raising over one billion dollars from 111,000 Chinese investors. BlackRock became the first foreign-owned company allowed by the Chinese government to operate a wholly-owned business in China's mutual fund industry.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Chandler |first1=Clay |last2=Gordon |first2=Nicholas |title=BlackRock is 'blundering' in Chinaâ€”all the way to the bank |url=https://fortune.com/2021/09/09/blackrock-china-mutual-fund-investment-soros-mistake/ |access-date=25 October 2021 |work=Fortune |date=September 9, 2021 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Madhok |first1=Diksha |title=Chinese investors pour $1 billion into BlackRock's new fund |url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/08/investing/blackrock-china-fund-intl-hnk/index.html |access-date=25 October 2021 |work=CNN |date=September 8, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=BlackRock's China unit raises $1 bln in maiden mutual fund |url=https://www.reuters.com/business/blackrocks-china-unit-raises-1-bln-maiden-mutual-fund-2021-09-08/ |work=Reuters |date=8 September 2021 |language=en}}</ref> Writing in ''The Wall Street Journal'', [[George Soros]] described BlackRock's initiative in China as a "tragic mistake" that would "damage the national security interests of the U.S. and other democracies."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Meredith |first1=Sam |title=BlackRock responds to George Soros' criticism over China investments |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/08/blackrock-responds-to-george-soros-criticism-over-china-investments.html |access-date=25 October 2021 |work=CNBC |date=8 September 2021 |language=en}}</ref>
